channel.title: Map Tweak Project - restoration and enhancement
channel.description:
This is a small project because I simply do not have time to do massive projects but I still want to contribute some things to either improve or enhance Black Mesa where possible.
My Goals are quite simple and are as follows.
1. Restore moved scene to original location in C3a2b Alien Grunt Forcing Doors open of main hallway - Status = [b]Done version 1.0[/b]
[url]https://www.mediafire.com/?jslp2l4jrfxcq7d[/url]
[u]Replace map in BMS / maps from the file updated the original is also included to erase the update [/u] 2. Restore the spinning fan blade in office complex vent to chop up headcrabs / move the scene of the zombie behind the door also to this area due to map layout alterations - Status = Not started
3. Improve the transition effects of the teleport orbs in Lambda core this will only be a test map example. Status = Started not tested
4. Improve the Headcrab digging it's way to the surface by adding a dust effect to the action test map example Status = Not started
5. Improve teleportation effects in Anomalous Materials Test Chamber whole map if possible and add missing teleport to the bullsquid Status = Not Started
6. Improve teleport sequence on to xen adding a wormwhole / vortex before credits / xen. Status = Not Started
7. Lock The door in QE before the laser puzzle so you cannot load back to the last level - Add fire damge if you try to go through the molten hole too early. And fix the trigger so you actally see the scripted sequence of the scientist blowing himself up with the tau cannon if it's included? Status = Not Started
It's a small project like I said but hope to get through it reasonably quick.. But quite busy with work at the moment and do not want to take on the responsibility of a massive project
Anyway These are my project goals but also would like to welcome other map tweaks and examples from others of trying to enhance or restore either whole maps or test rooms. But please [b][u]no maps with loads of enemies or weapons placed in the map i.e Shoot fest [/u][/b] claiming to be an enhancement or an improvement unless it is valid as an example and not detracting from what the game is... This is very important and I hope this is clear on the idea for this project.
This first post will be updated with download links and videos or images but for now I keep this a simple link on my first submission off the list
Any suggestions for small tweaks to be done mapping wise are also welcome and anyone who wants to strike any of these off the list by contributing is also welcome this is not a definitive list

item.dc:creator: D3lta
item.description:
Wangman:

Thanks for the heads up. This dude actually made some offensive comment to me in a previous post which I ignored so I decided to respond this time. I’ll be sure to report if this continues to be a problem. Also, I’m not interested in arguing with people on forums. The only reason why I’m here is to help Text finish his ST revisions and improve BMS. Once that’s done, I’m out permanently.

Nice to have a dev actually get back to me. I looked this up previously as well and my point still stands. Xenos is not an English word…it’s a Greek word (really an ancient version that may not even be in use). The closest thing in English it would resemble is a word-root. An example is “acro.” This is not a real word but can form real words when prefixed, such as “acrobat” or “acromegaly.” Similarly “xenos” is not a real word but can be combined to make “xenofauna,” which is what you’re trying to describe anyway (snarks).

The reason why I made such a stink about the grammar and design layout in QE is that it’s the ONLY chapter in BMS that has these issues. If you guys are serious about fixing this, I’d be glad to help you find all the errors. I have an extensive background in science and can help you with the proper phrasing. I also compiled a list of reasonable balance, AI and level design fixes that I sent to some of the dev team. I can also send you a copy if you haven’t seen it.

I’ve read my first reply back, and its I agree its kind of rude but I ment something else.Oh well.

It’s not an issue. Ancient Greek and Latin words are used all the time in science.

Dotard:

90% of those who have played the mod didn’t even notice alphabets on walls, thus not an issue.

Really? You didn’t read all the chalkboards on alien anatomy in QE, or the signs in AM, or the “Fire” buttons scattered throughout the game? What surprises me is that the organic chemistry, anatomy & physiology, and physics on those boards are legit. Why were the signs so messed up?
